microstructure: single-phase solid solution of BCC structure
processing_method: laser metal deposition (LMD) and vacuum arc melting (VAM)
evidence: NbMoTa refractory medium-entropy alloy (MEA) was fabricated by laser metal deposition (LMD) and vacuum arc melting (VAM) respectively. The crystal structures of NbMoTa MEA under two processes are all single-phase solid solution of BCC structure.

microstructure: cellular and columnar substructure within grains
evidence: The average values of H v are 356.3 ± 12.2, 333.2 ± 12.1, 220.2 ± 12.9, 486.8 ± 16.6, 516.6 ± 15.4 for LAMed Nb, Mo, Ta, NbMoTa and VAMed NbMoTa, respectively, shown in Fig.  6 (a).
The average values of H v are 356.3 ± 12.2, 333.2 ± 12.1, 220.2 ± 12.9, 486.8 ± 16.6, 516.6 ± 15.4 for LAMed Nb, Mo, Ta, NbMoTa and VAMed NbMoTa, respectively, shown in Fig.  6 (a).

microstructure: single-phase solid solution of BCC structure
evidence: the yield strength of the NbMoTa MEA at 1000 °C is slightly below to the VNbMoTaW HEA, higher than other refractory alloys like NbMoTaW HEA, Inconel 718, Ti6-Al4-V. The structure of NbMoTa MEA is a single-phase solid solution of BCC structure.

microstructure: singlephase solid solution of BCC structure, cellular and columnar within grains
evidence: (a) There is no obvious macroscopic burning loss to the elements in refractory NbMoTa MEA under LMD and VAM processes. The crystal structures of the MEA under two processes are all singlephase solid solution of BCC structure. (b) Due to the rapid solidification characteristics, the grain size of LMDed NbMoTa MEA is refined (13.18 μm) and the columnar crystals are randomly oriented on longitudinal solidification direction. The substructure is a typical cellular and columnar within grains. Due to the asymmetry of the melting point, tantalum with the highest melting point is solidified first, enriched in the interior of the substructure, forcing niobium with the lowest melting point enriched into the boundary of the substructure. (d) The experimental yield strength of VAMed NbMoTa MEA at room temperature was consistent with the calculated value through SSS theory. The experimental yield strength of VAMed MEA is higher than that of LMDed MEA in both room temperature and high temperature. This result is inconsistent with the microstructure of the MEA under two processes, not satisfying the Hall-petch relation. The yield strength and compressive strength of VAMed NbMoTa MEA at 1000 °C is 712 MPa and 920 MPa and it is competitive in high-temperature alloys.
